Reasoning: **Deciding on card strategy**

I need to determine how to select cards during the boss phase, where I'll discard two random cards for each hand played. I also need 22,000 chips for this. We have a strong joker set that includes two Photographs, which double the value of the first played face card. The Hanging Chad feature allows for the first card to score multiple times, increasing our points. I want the first scoring card to be a club to maximize multipliers.
**Clarifying scoring mechanics**

I’m realizing that the retrigger does repeat the scoring sequence for the cards, including scored jokers. The Photograph card is a joker that activates when the first face card is scored, offering a x2 multiplier. So, if that face card retriggers, it seems the Photograph could trigger again as it's still considered the first played face card. With the Hanging Chad giving two additional retriggers, that multiplies the Photograph's value to x8. It all seems to add up!
**Selecting the best hand**

The Ancient Joker boosts scores by x1.5 for each club card, meaning that if I score a club first, I get a significant multiplier of 3.375. It's crucial to ensure that the first scoring card is a club. Currently, my hand includes an Ace of Spades, two Jacks, and several other cards. I could create a Pair of Jacks, but my joker multipliers could make them valuable. Alternatively, I could go for Two Pair with Jacks and Tens. I think JH, JC, 10S, 10C, and 9C could work!
**Deciding on hand strategy**

With base chips at a 40 multiplier, I'm seeing some potential here. However, it seems I can't form three of a kind or a straight. I considered a flush but I don't have enough. I think my best option is to go for Two Pair using Tens and Jacks, ensuring I play a club card first. In this system, I can organize the play order, so I might use the rearrange_hand feature to position my scoring card first. Dragging to rearrange also seems like a solid option!
**Calculating hand scoring**

I can set the order using rearrange_hand, and I believe the cards are played in the specified selection order. I'm considering playing a club card first, possibly the Jack or Ten of Clubs, to score for Two Pair. The Ancient Joker gives a x1.5 multiplier for each club that's played, plus the Photograph gives x2 on the first face card scored. It looks like I can maximize my score by ensuring I play a club as my first card to optimize those multipliers! 

For scoring, I estimate that my Two Pair hand will provide a base of 40 chips, and with the multipliers applied, it could significantly increase my total. After calculating through the multipliers, I can get around 526.5 as my final multiplier, which should boost my chips quite nicely!

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
